description: The US says it is in response to 'Iran-affiliated attacks' on US personnel in Syria and Iraq
maintext:
The United States confirmed it conducted air strikes on two "Iran-affiliated" locations in Syria.
Lloyd Austin, the US Secretary of Defense, said it believes it targeted a training facility and a safe house in eastern Syria. It claims the two locations were being used by Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC).
Austin says the attack was in response to "continued attacks" against United States personnel in both Iraq and Syria. He said President Joe Biden was committed defending the USA.
It is the third time in less than three weeks the US has targeted locations in Syria. It claims the Iran-linked groups are behind a spike in attacks on US forces across the Middle East.
title: United States strikes two sites in Syria believed to be used by Iran
